Process.pn: Impose vector value by direction process
Process.help: This process fixes all the components of a given vector variable

parameter.help: Set Yes to activate the group
Choose if the solid should should be fixed, have an imposed motion or a free motion
Choose the way of imposing the external force in the X direction to the group
Insert the value of the external force in X direction
Insert here the name of the file containing the external force in X direction
Choose the way of imposing the external force in the Y direction to the group
Insert the value of the external force in Y direction
Insert here the name of the file containing the external force in Y direction
Choose the way of imposing the external force in the Z direction to the group
Insert the value of the external force in Z direction
Insert here the name of the file containing the external force in Z direction
Choose the way of imposing the external moment in the X direction to the group
Insert the value of the external force in X direction
Insert here the name of the file containing the external force in X direction
Choose the way of imposing the external moment in the Y direction to the group
Insert the value of the external force in Y direction
Insert here the name of the file containing the external force in Y direction
Choose the way of imposing the external moment in the Z direction to the group
Insert the value of the external force in Z direction
Insert here the name of the file containing the external force in Z direction
If activated, the imposed velocity values are the maximum during a harmonic oscillation with a given period
In 2D it is automatically set to +Z
Components of the position of the Rotation Center. If a linear velocity is imposed to this group, it will affect this center
If activated, the imposed velocity values are the maximum during a harmonic oscillation with a given period
If activated, the wall will not move and will just have an imposed velocity field
Specify if the wall presents a cohesive behaviour
If activated, wear will be computed on this wall. It can increase computation time
Give this DEM-FEM group an ideally rigid behaviour or an elastic response with a particular Young Modulus
Define the loading wall for material testing
Check Y-axis is the loading axis

Process.pn: Impose vector value by direction process
Process.help: This process fixes all the components of a given vector variable

parameter.help: active: the imposed velocity values are the maximum of an harmonic oscillation with the given period
Components of the position of the rotation center. Linear velocity is imposed to this center
active: the imposed velocity values are the maximum of an harmonic oscillation with the given period

Process.pn: Impose vector value by direction process
Process.help: This process fixes all the components of a given vector variable

parameter.help: active: the imposed velocity values are the maximum of an harmonic oscillation with the given period
Components of the position of the rotation center. Linear velocity is imposed to this center
active: the imposed velocity values are the maximum of an harmonic oscillation with the given period
Type of particle to insert. Single particles, clusters or user defined cluster file.
Choose the probablility distribution of the diameter
Standard Deviation of the Diameter, assuming Normal Distribution. If 0.0 is chosen, a uniform diameter distribution will be created
Choose the shape of the particle or cluster of particles
First parameter of the imaginary part of the orientation quaternion
Second parameter of the imaginary part of the orientation quaternion
Third parameter of the imaginary part of the orientation quaternion
Real part of the orientation quaternion
active: the imposed velocity values are the maximum of an harmonic oscillation with the given period
Components of the position of the rotation center. Linear velocity is imposed to this center
active: the imposed velocity values are the maximum of an harmonic oscillation with the given period
Decide what mpda file you want this SubModelPart to be added to
